radiographic_examinations.findings: Gallbladder is markedly distended with wall thickening and pericholecystic fluid. Stones and sludge are identified in the gallbladder. A small obstructing stone is identified in the cystic duct. Liver is normal in size; no focal hepatic lesions. No evidence of choledocholithiasis. Clear lung bases; no suspicious pulmonary nodules or pleural effusions.
